Lower HEV shedding by pigs in Czech Republic might reflect different farming methods, such as animal housing and separation, herd size, slaughtering age, and/or environmental factors that possibly influence infectious HEV persistence, spread, and transmission. Previous data from Czech Republic (
37 ) showed up to 40.0% HEV-positive bile samples from piglets, suggesting infection rates close to shedding rates reported for Italy and Spain. However, that study did not examine HEV fecal shedding, and pigs were only 2â€“3 months of age. Furthermore, varying prevalence of HEV in pig feces also has been reported in Italy and Spain (
15
,
38 ), possibly reflecting differences in farm selection.
